intro: Serratula trautvetteriana, commonly known as Trautvetter's serratula, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its flowers, which bloom in the summer, are yellow with a central disc of smaller florets. Serratula trautvetteriana is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
